intro: Tissa salina var. sanfordii, commonly known as the Sanford's saltbush, is a shrub native to arid and semi-arid regions. It is characterized by its small, waxy leaves that help reduce water loss in saline soils. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers that bloom in the spring. It is often found in coastal areas and salt marshes due to its tolerance of high salinity. Its root system is adapted to stabilize sandy or salty soils, making it an important plant in ecological restoration projects.
